Dialogue.Page: Hello, Hatchling. And welcome to the Sunset Sister Power Unit.

DialogueOption.Text: How do you know my language?
How did you get those pictures of me?
Why did you build the SSPU?
How do you know my language?
How did you get those pictures of me?
Why did you build the SSPU?

Dialogue.Page: I've seen you wandering around Bruised Brother's moon system. I was able to track you down to two of the nearest stars; Goldspark and X3NJ-AM3.
You're the only one aware of the time loops that I've seen, so I must congratulate you.
The Goldspark system; the fifth nearest to this group of <color=orange>miniature</color> systems.
After locating your origin to it, I spent some time looking around your home system. You have a very thoughtful <color=orange>community</color>, I'll give you that much.
Are you reffering to the Sunset Sister Power Unit or this moon system?
My clan used a vessel to travel to the system. That being the Central Station in the core of this cluster.
After months--years?--of neglecting it, another clan found it and used it as a hub for a festival.
This place, the SSPU (or Sunset Sister Power Unit), is <color=orange>isolated</color> inside of Sunset Sister. The <color=orange>layers</color> of the object go Sunset -> Maze -> SSPU.
The safeguards were made so no-one died from the sheer heat of the compacted star. The entrance was <color=orange>hidden in plain sight</color> all this time, eh?

DialogueTree.DialogueNode: 4. The way warp cores worked were...inneficient. It works fine, but it required charging after some time. That's why we wanted to change that. It all went horribly. Entry2

Dialogue.Page: I believe your journey ends here.
If you ever feel like you're forgotten, and everything is hopeless, do not give up.
